subtests.name: The closest snap point is preferred than scroll-snap-stop: always where it's further than the destination (the closest one is closer to the scroll start position than the destination)
The closest snap point is preferred than scroll-snap-stop: always where it's further than the destination (the closest one is futrher than the destination from the start position)
The scroll destination on a large element whose snap area covers the snapport entirely is a valid snap position
The scroll destination on a large element whose snap area covers the snapport entirely is a valid snap position (with two `scroll-snap-stop: always` snap points
`scroll-snap-stop: always` snap point is preferred even if the snap area entire snapport
`scroll-snap-stop: always` snap point is further than the scroll destination
`scroll-snap-stop: always` snap point is further than the scroll destination and a snap area covers the snapport
